candidates.title: Refactor client to be network-agnostic
candidates.body:
`grammers-client` no longer concerns itself with stepping. This is now done in the `grammers-mtsender` crate via the new `SenderPool`. The `Client` now only needs a way to `invoke_in_dc` (this may be possible to turn into a `trait` in the future so users can provide their own `SenderPool`-esque logic).

The refactor is not fully complete:

- [x] Review that dead connections notify pending requests correctly.
- [x] Review that failing to connect does not panic.
- [ ] Lost reconnection policies.
- [x] Lost proxy support.
- [ ] Lost WASM support.
- [x] Lost authentication exports (and thus downloads from other DCs).
- [ ] Likely want a way to terminate idle connections (like Telethon).
- [x] Improve back some logs to re-include the constructor name.
- [ ] Should be possible to reduce cloning when re-attempting requests.
- [x] The way the handle and particularly the updates are dealt with is somewhat clunky.
- [x] Duplicating the `api_id` is unfortunate (future refactor: move `api_hash` to just the methods that need it? Or is it nice to give early?)
- [x] Probably rename client's `Config` to `Configuration` to be consistent.
- [ ] Some other things I might be missing.
- [x] Quit is nice but query / reconfigure feel like a hack. Should probably just share the session. And Quit should not be a "forget and you're locked" - if all handles are dropped, the pool should die out.

candidates.title: Add serde support for session crate
candidates.body:
This PR do 2 things:

1. Add serde support to grammers_session crates, set it as an optional feature.
2. Lock grammers_session and  grammers_tl_types serde dependency from "1.0.xxx" to "~1.0".

I also tried use workspace dependency to lock a fix version of serde, but cargo workspace dependency does not support optional dependency.

candidates.title: [WASM-4] Clean up mtsender, ws support and small changes to make it usable
candidates.body:
After this PR users should be able to use grammers in the browser! We still have a lot of testing and documenting to do but that's for another PR.

## Changes:
- Moved `NetStream` into a new mod called `net` and separate net code from the actual mtsender implementation.
- Implement WebSocket support using `ws_stream_wasm`.
- Declare a new type for the transport type in client to allow changing it using cfg.
- Use padded intermediate with obfuscation as the transport when targeting web.
- Enable the `js` feature of `getrandom` to avoid getting compile errors.
- Add a compile error when the user tries to build with the `fs` or `proxy` features but is targeting web.

candidates.title: [WASM-3] Time suff
candidates.body:
### Changes:
- Replace usages of `tokio::time` and `std::time` with `web-time` 
- Change the `deps` test add the ability to scan target-specific dependencies
- Disable the test that checks if client is `Send` when targeting web as JS objects are not thread-safe (there's no "thread" to begin with)
- Implement `sleep` and `sleep_until` using js `setTimeout()`

candidates.title: [WASM-2] Put code using fs APIs under their own feature
candidates.body:
The title is pretty self-explanatory.

This is needed for when we add wasm support as fs is not supported there.
It also has the added bonus of allowing people to guarantee that the crate does not create any files without the feature.

candidates.title: [WASM-1] Implement the obfuscated MTProto transport
candidates.body:
This PR implements support for [transport obfuscation](https://core.telegram.org/mtproto/mtproto-transports#transport-obfuscation). It is the first step towards a web port.

## Changes I had to make to make this feasible:
- `Transport::unpack()` now takes in a mutable reference to the buffer to do the decryption in-place.
- ~`Transport::unpack()` now returns `Result<Vec<UnpackedOffset>>`. This is needed since a read might, and frequently will, contain multiple transport payloads.~
- ~`Transport::unpack()` now returns an empty Vec instead of `Error::MissingBytes` when there's more data needed.~
- `ctr` is a new dependency in `grammers-mtsender`.
- `Transport::unpack()` must now be called with the same buffer and the buffer must be kept between calls.

~While changing the return type of unpack to a `Vec` doesn't also seem good, it was the only compromise I could think of to allow this transport to work without significant performance impact while also keeping the decryption contained inside of the transport implementation.~

I'm now storing the decryption state inside the transport itself. So should have almost zero overhead other than the encryption itself

candidates.title: deps: trust-dns is no longer maintained, move into hickory-dns
Add serde support for tl_types.
candidates.body:
Add two lines for each entrance in generated.rs 
- all enums
- all structs
(Did I miss for other things?)

Pass all tests in crate `grammers-tl-types`

candidates.title: Fixing incorrect password hash calculations
candidates.body: Previously you would get "PASSWORD_HASH_INVALID" for correct password sometimes. It should be fixed now.

candidates.title: Add some getters and unstable_raw feature
candidates.body:
- `as_raw` for Group, Channel and User under "unstable_raw"
- `is_animated` and `is_spoiler` for Document media type
- `is_spoiler` for Photo media type
- `access_hash` and `file_reference` for Photo and Document media types under "unstable_raw"
